page.title: 03VINES CONT.& LYDHURST ESTATE
page.content: At Biddenden they pay for him to use the equipment. They now have 10 goats and produce and sell dairy products and intend to expand into tunnels for growing soft fruit-perhaps for flavouring yoghurts. {LYDHURST VINES Map ref.245258 { Mr.& Mrs.J.Hayward}have a vineyard on 1acre of Lydhurst estate.Their wine is a{dry white}but they do not sell it. Rock Lodge Vineyards from Scaynes Hill pick their grapes and make the wine for them.The number of bottles varies according to the crop and the weather.In 1984 they had 1,500 bottles but the previous year there weren't enough grapes to employ the winemaker and so they gave the crop away to a local man who makes his own wine. {Lydhust}has belonged to the{Haywards since{1939}and has 250 acres.They also keep a flock of Scotch Half-bred sheep
